name: Cumulative Volume Delta
description: Shows the cumulative difference between buying and selling volume, indicating buying or selling pressure.

name: Money Flow Index
description: A momentum indicator that uses both price and volume to identify overbought or oversold conditions.

name: Open Interest
description: The total number of outstanding derivative contracts. Rising open interest indicates new money entering the market.

name: Funding Rate
description: Periodic payments exchanged between traders to keep perpetual contract prices close to the spot price.

name: True Strength Index
description: A momentum oscillator based on a double smoothing of price changes, used to identify trend direction and overbought/oversold conditions.

name: Trend Strength Index (ADX)
description: The Average Directional Index measures the strength of a trend, regardless of its direction.

name: Choppiness Index
description: An indicator designed to determine if the market is trending or ranging (choppy).

name: Bollinger Bands
description: A volatility indicator consisting of a middle band (SMA) and two outer bands based on standard deviations.

name: Relative Strength Index (RSI)
description: A momentum oscillator that measures the speed and change of price movements to identify overbought or oversold conditions.

name: Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD)
description: A trend-following momentum indicator that shows the relationship between two exponential moving averages of a securityâ€™s price.

name: Stochastic Oscillator
description: A momentum indicator comparing a particular closing price of a security to a range of its prices over a certain period of time.

name: Price Velocity (% Change)
description: Measures the rate of price change over a specific interval. For live data, it's the percentage change from the candle's open to close. For historical candles, it's the percentage change from the candle's open to close.

name: Accumulated Velocity Score
description: A composite score representing the sum of absolute velocity percentages across multiple timeframes (1m, 3m, 5m, 15m, 30m, 1h, 4h, 24h). Used to identify instruments with high momentum across different resolutions.
